qas.question: Which console featured a top-loading design?
The design of what was modified slightly?
the original design of the controller was what shape?
What was the new design shape of the controller?
How long were standard NES controller cables?
Which console featured a bottom-loading design?
The design of what wasn't modified slightly?
the unoriginal design of the controller was what shape?
What was the new design shape of the old controller?
How long were nonstandard NES controller cables?

context: Near the end of the NES's lifespan, upon the release of the AV Famicom and the top-loading <a0_0><b5_0>NES 2<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the design of the <a1_0><b6_0>game controllers<b6_0/><a1_0/> was modified slightly. Though the original button layout was retained, the redesigned device abandoned the <a2_0><b7_0>brick<b7_0/><a2_0/> shell in favor of a <a3_0><b8_0>dog bone<a3_0/> shape<b8_0/>. In addition, the AV Famicom joined its international counterpart and dropped the hardwired controllers in favor of detachable controller ports. However, the controllers included with the Famicom AV had cables which were 90 cm (3 feet) long, as opposed to the standard 180 cm(<a4_0><b9_0>6 feet<b9_0/><a4_0/>) of NES controllers.
